metadata.titleEn: Provenance analysis data sets of Cenozoic strata of Nepal in the southern Tibetan Plateau
metadata.description: Provenance of Cretaceous-Miocene sedimentary rocks in the Nepalese Lesser Himalayas is significant for understanding the timing and pattern of the India-Asia collision and tectonic evolution of the Himalaya orogen. This research analyses the provenance of Cretaceous-Miocene sedimentary rocks in two representative sections (Butwal section and Kalya section) in Nepalese Lesser Himalaya, which constrain the timing and pattern of the India-Asia collision and reconstruct the tectonic evolution of the Himalayan orogen. An ATL 193 nm ArF excimer laser ablation (LA) system coupled with an Agilent 7700X inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry (ICP-MS) instrument was adopted to complete detrital zircon U-Pb dating of ten samples; A Geolas HD LA system coupled with a Neupane Plus multi-collector ICP-MS instrument were used to complete zircon in-situ Hf isotope analysis. Analytical results of detrital zircon U-Pb-Hf indicate that the timing of the India-Asia collision was no later than the early-middle Eocene in the central Himalayas, and the Greater Himalayas exposed to the surface by the early Miocene.
metadata.instructions: The data files are named “Provenance analysis data sets of Cenozoic strata in the southern Tibetan Plateau_Detrital zircon U-Pb age data” and “Provenance analysis data sets of Cenozoic strata in the southern Tibetan Plateau_Zircon in-situ Hf isotope data” based on its content. It was stored as a .xlsx file and can be opened and read by the Excel program directly.

literatureList.titleEn: Constraints on the timing of the India-Asia collision and unroofing history of the Himalayan orogen using detrital zircon U-Pb-Hf and whole-rock Sr-Nd isotopes in Cretaceous-Miocene Lesser Himalayan sedimentary rocks
literatureList.referenceEn: Feng, W., Meng, Q.Q., Song, C.H., Fang, X.M., Zhuang, G.S., He, P.J., Yang, S.F., Zhang, J., Chen, Y.F., & Zhang, Y.H. (2022). Constraints on the timing of the India-Asia collision and unroofing history of the Himalayan orogen using detrital zircon U-Pb-Hf and whole-rock Sr-Nd isotopes in Cretaceous-Miocene Lesser Himalayan sedimentary rocks. Basin Research, doi: 10.1111/bre.12742.

Example.Question: Can you provide an example of a data collection method used to determine the timing and process of the India-Asia continental collision through sediment source analysis in Southern Tibet?
Example.Answer: An example of a data collection method used for this purpose is the combined use of an ATL-193nm ArF laser ablation system connected to an Agilent 7700X ICP-MS for U-Pb dating of detrital zircons, along with a Geolas HD LA system connected to a Neptune Plus MC-ICP-MS for in-situ zircon Hf isotope testing. This method was applied to analyze samples from two representative sections in the Lower Himalayas of Nepal, which helped constrain the timing of the India-Asia collision and understand the tectonic evolution of the Himalayan orogenic belt.

Feature Specification.Question: What characteristics define the data collection methods used for U-Pb-Hf isotopic analysis in sediment provenance studies in the context of the Himalayas?
Feature Specification.Answer: ATL-193nm ArF laser ablation (LA) systems, Agilent 7700X inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometer (ICP-MS), Geolas HD LA system, Neptune Plus multi-collector ICP-MS

Definition.Question: What does '碎屑锆石U-Pb测年' refer to in the context of geochronological data collection methods?
Definition.Answer: 碎屑锆石U-Pb测年 refers to a geochronological data collection method involving U-Pb dating of detrital zircon grains, used to determine the age of sedimentary deposits. This method involves using an ATL-193nm ArF laser ablation system connected to an Agilent 7700X ICP-MS to measure the isotopic ratios in zircon samples, which helps to constrain the timing of geological events such as the India-Asia continental collision.

Causal Antecedent.Question: What factors influence the choice of data collection methods for analyzing sediment provenance in the Cretaceous-Miocene formations of the Nepalese Lesser Himalayas?
Causal Antecedent.Answer: The choice of data collection methods for analyzing sediment provenance in the Cretaceous-Miocene formations of the Nepalese Lesser Himalayas is influenced by the need to accurately determine the timing and mechanisms of the India-Asia continental collision and to reconstruct the tectonic evolution of the Himalayan orogeny. Techniques such as U-Pb dating of detrital zircons using laser ablation systems connected to mass spectrometers are utilized to achieve precise chronological constraints. Additionally, in-situ Hf isotope testing of zircons is performed to further understand the provenance and tectonic settings. These methods are chosen for their ability to provide detailed geochronological and isotopic data essential for interpreting geological histories.

Causal Consequence.Question: What are the potential impacts on the understanding of the India-Asia continental collision and the tectonic evolution of the Himalayas when utilizing advanced techniques like LA-ICP-MS and MC-ICP-MS for zircon U-Pb-Hf isotopic analysis in sedimentary provenance studies?
Causal Consequence.Answer: Utilizing advanced techniques like LA-ICP-MS and MC-ICP-MS for zircon U-Pb-Hf isotopic analysis allows for precise dating and isotopic characterization of detrital zircons, which can lead to a more accurate constraint on the timing and manner of the India-Asia continental collision. This also aids in reconstructing the tectonic evolution history of the Himalayan orogeny, suggesting that the collision in the central Himalayas occurred no later than the early to middle Eocene, and that the High Himalayas were exposed to the surface by at least the early Miocene.

Goal Orientation.Question: What is the primary objective of analyzing sediment provenance in the Cretaceous-Miocene strata of the southern Tibetan Plateau using U-Pb dating and Hf isotopic analysis?
Goal Orientation.Answer: The primary objective is to constrain the timing and manner of the India-Asia continental collision and to reconstruct the tectonic evolutionary history of the Himalayan orogenic belt. This is achieved by analyzing sediment provenance through U-Pb dating and Hf isotopic analysis of detrital zircons, which provides insights into the geological processes involved in the formation and development of the region.

Instrumental/Procedural.Question: What are the procedural steps and instruments involved in conducting U-Pb dating of detrital zircon samples to analyze sediment provenance in the Himalaya region?
Instrumental/Procedural.Answer: The procedural steps and instruments involved include using the ATL-193nm ArF laser ablation (LA) system connected to an Agilent 7700X inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometer (ICP-MS) to perform U-Pb dating of detrital zircon samples. Additionally, the Geolas HD LA system connected to a Neptune Plus multi-collector ICP-MS is used for in-situ Hf isotope testing. These methodologies help constrain the timing and manner of India-Asia continental collision and understand the tectonic evolution of the Himalayan orogeny.
